body:
Can you play other OpenGL games?

Can you paste the output of `xdpyinfo` and `glxinfo`?

I am able to play  Warzone 2100 just fine (don't know if that is opengl or not though)
That looks fine at first glance. I'm afraid Warzone 2100 might not be the best test, as the version shipped with Ubuntu/Mint still uses SDL 1.2, while we're at 2.0.
Warzone 2100 is still in OpenGL 1.x AFAIK.
Damn. Any easy to download game with SDL2.0? Thanks for being so helpful!
Also, I might've messed up installing SDL2.0 from source code, as I am new to Linux. How can I completely uninstall SDL2.0 and start over?

If you still have the source code on your disk, try and see if the Makefile has an `uninstall` target.

Also libsdl2 is shipped with Ubuntu/Mint, there shouldn't be a need to compile it yourself for the average user. If you already had the official package installed but overwrote its files with your self-compiled ones, the cleanup might need a bit more work.

Thanks so much! make uninstall worked. 

However now, the UI of openra is flickering. But nothing else is.

Glad this is resolved. https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/8340 seems to be a similar report with screen flicker.

I use an Intel HD 4000 with @openSUSE 13.2 and Tumbleweed without problems regarding OpenRA.
